intro: Grewia erythrocarpa, commonly known as the red-fruited bush, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clustered, red berries that turn orange when ripe. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. The berries are edible and have been traditionally used in local cuisines and herbal remedies.
